text: Hey guys, I need some guidance. Problem: We're adding semantic HTML5 tags to our new website (<main>, <article>, <section>, etc). basically the issue is that if we open the <main> tag in the above the fold module, we can't close it in (for example) the pre footer module. We have to close it within the same module (in this case, the above the fold one) which is not useful for us. Do you think is there any other workaround other than cloning the template in raw HTML to edit the code directly?

Is there a way to change the icons being used in this Social Sharing module? I've added this module to the header of my theme and am now experimenting with things from a content manager's perspective. But I can't see any options to change the image being used and I can't work out where these images are coming from in order to try to manually change them. Any ideas?

You should be able to find the module under the link `https://app.HubSpot.com/design-manager/[[ PORTAL _ID ]]/modules/p/@HubSpot/social_sharing` or by adding it to a template, right click, "Edit module source code".

You'll need to clone the module as you can't edit default ones, but it pulls the images from the linked files in the sidebar and sets that file as the logo variable when where you see `{% set logo = networkName ~'-color.png' %}` - so adding in new image files and changing that variable should work
Is it possible to disable some of the default modules in an account? I would like to encourage using our custom modules vs the default ones that are currently taking prominence.
add there first and ask for upvotes on the <#C26E7JT8V|ideas> channel here!
